com.nokia.examples
Class NfcManager

java.lang.Object
  com.nokia.examples.NfcManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, javax.microedition.contactless.TargetListener
public class NfcManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.microedition.contactless.TargetListener, java.lang.Runnable

Manages NFC interaction with the target.

Author:
Andreas Jakl

private InfoInterface callback

dm

private javax.microedition.contactless.DiscoveryManager dm
Manager for discovering targets.

ndconn

private javax.microedition.contactless.ndef.NDEFTagConnection ndconn
Connection to the tag is saved here, as the actual processing is happening in a thread.

cachedMessage

private javax.microedition.contactless.ndef.NDEFMessage cachedMessage
When cloning a tag, cache the NDEF message in memory.

ndefMode

private boolean ndefMode
Set to true to connect to a tag using an NDEF connection if possible, or false to create a low-level connection. Note: low-level connection currently only supported for Mifare tags.

mifareManager

MifareManager mifareManager
Mifare manager, establishes tag-specific Mifare connections if requested.

uriAbbreviations

private static final java.lang.String[] uriAbbreviations
Standardized abbreviations used to save bytes on NDEF URI records.

Constructor Detail

NfcManager

public NfcManager(InfoInterface callback)
Create a new instance of the Nfc Manager.

Method Detail

setNdefMode

public void setNdefMode(boolean ndefEnabled)
Set to true if this class should establish an NDEF connection. Otherwise, it will establish a direct tag connection to read the raw data. Note: currently, the raw connection is only supported for Mifare tags.

deleteNfcInstances

public void deleteNfcInstances(boolean alsoRemoveDiscoveryManager)
Delete & close all Nfc connections.

Parameters:
alsoRemoveDiscoveryManager - if true, also the DiscoveryManager is deleted and its listener removed.

createNfcDiscoveryManager

public boolean createNfcDiscoveryManager()
Create a new instance of the discovery manager, so that callbacks can be received.

Returns:
whether establishing the connection was successful.

targetDetected

public void targetDetected(javax.microedition.contactless.TargetProperties[] targetProperties)
Implementation of the call-back function of the TargetListener.

Specified by:
targetDetected in interface javax.microedition.contactless.TargetListener
Parameters:
targetProperties - array of targets found by the phone

getNdefTagConnection

private javax.microedition.contactless.ndef.NDEFTagConnection getNdefTagConnection(javax.microedition.contactless.TargetProperties[] tProp)
Open the connection to the NDEF tag when a target was found. Shows an alert if there is an issue opening the connection.

Parameters:
tProp - array containing all target properties that will be searched for an NDEF connection.
Returns:
a NDEF tag connection if one was found, or null otherwise.

run

public void run()
Used to inform the callback about a new tag in a separated thread, as recommended by the JSR documentation.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

checkNdefConnection

private boolean checkNdefConnection()
Check if the NDEF connection is still set. Will do a callback to the listener class in case no connection is currently active. (in addition to the callback in case of a failure).

Returns:
true if a connection is active, false if otherwise.

readMessageFromTag

private javax.microedition.contactless.ndef.NDEFMessage readMessageFromTag()

writeMessageToTag

private boolean writeMessageToTag(javax.microedition.contactless.ndef.NDEFMessage ndefMessage)

handleException

private void handleException(java.lang.Exception ex)

readNDEFMessage

public void readNDEFMessage()
Processing method to read an NDEF message from a pre-established tag connection.

readAndCacheMessage

public boolean readAndCacheMessage()
Read the message and cache it in memory. The message is not parsed.

Returns:
true on success, false when there was a problem reading a valid message.

readRawData

public boolean readRawData()
Read raw data from the tag and log it to a file.

Returns:
true if successful

deleteNDEFMessage

public void deleteNDEFMessage()
Processing method to delete an NDEF message from a pre-established tag connection. Writes an empty message if a message already exists on the tag. Doesn't do anything if the tag is already empty.

writeUri

public void writeUri(java.lang.String fullUrl)
              throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
Processing method to write an NDEF message containing a URI record to a pre-established tag connection.

Parameters:
fullUrl - URI to be written into the URI record of the NDEF message. Any possible abbreviations of the URL are done automatically.
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

writeText

public void writeText(java.lang.String fullText,
                      java.lang.String language)
               throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
Processing method to write an NDEF message containing a text record to a pre-established tag connection.

Parameters:
fullText - text to be written into the text record of the NDEF message.
language - language to use for the text record
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

writeSmartPoster

public void writeSmartPoster(boolean[] writeMessages,
                             java.lang.String fullUrl,
                             java.lang.String fullText,
                             byte posterAction,
                             java.lang.String imageUri)
                      throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                             java.io.IOException
Processing method to write a Smart Poster NDEF message to a pre-established tag connection. Which parts of the possible information has to be specified in the boolean array writeMessages[]. Note that the URL is mandatory according to the Smart Poster specification.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

writeGeo

public void writeGeo(double latitude,
                     double longitude,
                     int geoType)
              throws java.io.IOException
Write geo-coordinates to a URL NDEF message to a pre-established tag connection.

Parameters:
latitude -
longitude -
geoType - 0 ... geo: URI scheme, according to http://geouri.org/ 1 ... Nokia Maps link
Throws:
java.io.IOException

convertToVcalTime

private java.lang.String convertToVcalTime(java.util.Date datetime,
                                           boolean useUtcTime)
Convert a Date object to the representation required by the vCalendar standard. Resulting format: yyyymmddThhmmss (uppercase T character as separator between date and time). This method isn't time zone aware.

Parameters:
datetime - date and time to convert
Returns:
date and time as string suitable for a vCalendar entry.
